title.rendered: The video game industry VS the NFTs Who has…

content.rendered:
Team17, one of the video game publishers most important in the market, announced a few days ago the intention of launching its own NFT collection based on the mythical characters wormsin collaboration with the blockchain company Reality Gaming Group. It was also emphasized that the project would be linked to a campaign to invest in worm beds destinated to break down organic matterand that energy cost it would be much less compared to other alternatives, equivalent to “what 11 households spend on heating kettles each year”.

However, the adventure was short-lived, because the company had to come out with this announcement: “Team17 announces the end of its MetaWorms NFT project. We have listened to our employees, partner developers and player communities, as well as their concerns, and We have made the decision to step back from the NFT market.”

Why did they back down? It’s simple: they received the critics both of the fans of the games as of the independent studies with whom they work. And it is that he did not manage to clarify his intentions with the environment: many still think that a little effort is not enough.

The authors of overcookedfor example, (Ghost Town Games) were clear in their opposition to the project, stating that they “will never engage with NFTs” because they believe they carry a “great environmental and social cost.” Aggro Crab, the studio responsible for going under, He released a slightly more… intense statement. “We believe that NFTs cannot be environmentally friendly, nor useful, and are really just a general bullshit scam,” they stated, while also announcing that they would not work with Team17 again in future games, and encouraging other independent studios to do the same.

Something similar happened with Ubisoft since they announced Quartz: the french syndicate Solidaires Informatique Jeu Vidéoof which many employees of UbisoftParis, stated that “blockchain is a harmful, worthless, dead-end feature” and that they are very much against the company dabbling in NFTs. “Our gamers deserve better than useless, expensive, and ecologically deadly technology that turns them into the goal of less regulated capitalism. Since the monetization of game time is a future of misery, we ask the group’s management to stop the development of this technology.” However, for the moment, the company turned a deaf ear and there is no news regarding the new division, as they seem to be going ahead with their project.
